intro: Meryta mauluulu, commonly known as the Tahitian meryta, is a flowering plant native to the Society Islands in French Polynesia. It is a member of the Araliaceae family and is characterized by its evergreen, leathery leaves and showy white flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 5 meters. Its fruit is a small, fleshy drupe that contains a single seed. Meryta mauluulu is adapted to coastal and humid environments, often found in forested areas with well-drained soil.
